greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number G(n,k) of set partitions of {1,...,n} into sets of size at most k; triangle G(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: _John Riordan_ calls these Allied Bell Numbers. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 10 2018
G(n,k) is defined for n,k >= 0.  The triangle contains only the terms with k<=n. G(n,k) = G(n,n) = A000110(n) for k>n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
formula: G(0,k) = 1, G(n,k) = 0 for n>0 and k<1, otherwise G(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..floor(n/k)} G(n-k*j,k-1) * n!/(k!^j*(n-k*j)!*j!).
E.g.f. of column k: exp(Sum_{j=1..k} x^j/j!).
maple: G:= proc(n, k) option remember; local j; if k>n then G(n, n)
elif n=0 then 1 elif k<1 then 0 else G(n-k, k);
for j from k-1 to 1 by -1 do %*(n-j)/j +G(n-j,k) od; % fi
G:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, add(
seq(seq(G(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..10);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 26 2017
mathematica: g[n_, k_] := g[n, k] = If[n == 0, 1, If[k < 1, 0, Sum[g[n - k*j, k - 1] *n!/k!^j/(n - k*j)!/j!, { j, 0, n/k}]]]; Table[Table[g[n, k], { k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 09 2013, translated from Maple *)
xref: Main diagonal gives: A000110. Lower diagonal gives: A058692.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 16 2013
